website_summaries.verdict: Roku's Streaming Stick offers tons of apps, a real remote, and a compact design for just $50, making it the best streaming stick and an outstanding value.
pros: The Roku Streaming Stick packs the entire Roku experience into a compact device that lives behind your TV and costs just $50
Over 1,200 apps are available, including Netflix, Amazon Instant, HBO Go, Hulu Plus, Pandora, MLB.TV, Amazon Cloud Player, Vudu, and Showtime Anytime
There's also a cross-platform search function that combs through several major TV and movie services to find content
And unlike the Chromecast, it has a real remote and an onscreen interface, which tends to work better in the living room
cons: Some apps, like YouTube, take a long time to boot up
The included remote doesn't have the neat headphone jack feature that's available on the Roku 3 and Roku 2
And if you used your TV's USB port for power, the device will likely need to boot-up when you turn your TV on

customer_reviews.text: UPDATE: A new versioncan be ordered now. It's still a Roku Stick but faster, slimmer and with some new features such as 'private listening through a phone. Since the price difference is only ten dollars, I can think of no good reason to order this model as a 'new' purchase at this time.

customer_reviews.title: Works great even with my older TV that doesn't have HDMI
customer_reviews.text: Works great even with my older TV that doesn't have HDMI. I was ready to return it because there was no sound (I have DVI with HDMI adopter so I guess it's wasn't a true HDMI connection) but I found a great sound extractor that takes in the Stick on one side and connects to the TV on the other through a DVI to HDMI. customer_reviews.text: Happiness is kicking your cable-provider to the curb. It is a slightly more convenient if you're using it to travel around or move your Roku around the house to different TV sets, but otherwise go for the other version over this. As they say, "If it's too good to be true, it usually is".

customer_reviews.title: Remote is worthless, but the stick seems to work well
customer_reviews.text: The remote is worthless (barely ever stays connected), but I found that the remote app for your smartphone works really nice and has more capabilities. If you have a high-speed, strong Wi-Fi signal, this product works well. User friendly interface and TONS of options for content. We mainly use it for watching Netflix. I have the Roku plugged directly into my Denon receiver so I can get Dolby Digitial Surround (when supported by the show you're watching). Can't get Dolby Digital 5.1 if the Roku is plugged into your TV and you use ARC (audio return channel) to listen to audio from a receiver, as ARC doesn't support it (you'd just get plain stereo).

customer_reviews.title: Doesnt work

Awful customer service... was told because I hadn't called with 2 weeks that he couldn't help me beca use the warranty had expired.... I just wanted the he stupid thing to sync with my TV. Very suprised... I have purchased other Roku devices and always been very satisfied. I wold buy another model....but not this one
customer_reviews.author: Kate

customer_reviews.title: No disappoints here
customer_reviews.text: SO much better than a Smart TV. I had nothing but frustrations trying to watch Netflix from my Smart TV. I finally got rid of it, got a regular ol' TV and this little stick and now am happy as a clam. It was super easy to set up. Online research suggested that if it wasn't plugged into an outside power source (not just the USB port on the TV), it would take 180 seconds to power up after having turned the TV off. That hasn't been true for me. I haven't timed it but my guess is about 30 seconds. So far it has been completely reliable with no hiccups, no connection problems, no update issues. I love it.
customer_reviews.author: Shelley S. Clark

customer_reviews.title: Roku is a big deal why?
customer_reviews.text: With XBMC out there this device along with Apple TV, Amazon Fire TV, Chromecast etc... are all very short in content!!!....That said...its an easy install...some of the best channels are found courtesy of private channels just google it....its has a little lag with remote commands, can get frustrating after a while...if you have an usb slot in your tv make sure it can power this stick...my Sharp Tv could not hold the charge and I had to use the power cord provided...so much for discreet.. you get a nice stream most of the time, of course Wifi and streaming depends on your connection....overall not a bad device to have in a spare room just to have content to view......
customer_reviews.author: D.P.

customer_reviews.title: Cheap, reliable, flexible
customer_reviews.text: In college, I gave up cable because of the cost. When I got my first full-time, post-college job, I tired of watching Netflix on my laptop because of the small screen and mediocre speakers. Roku has allowed me to stream directly to my TV, which makes entertaining more pleasant. I was surprised by the number of channels available on Roku, and while some of them require a monthly subscription, a surprising number are free or offer some free and some paid content. Setting this up was easy and the step-by-step directions were accurate. I have found this to work very reliably. This really seems like one of the cheapest, most flexible options for on-demand streaming.
customer_reviews.author: Brittany

customer_reviews.title: Very Pleased So Far
customer_reviews.text: I got this yesterday and installed it last night. We are very pleased so far. Setup was fast and easy. As some other reviewers have said, the remote doesn't always seem to work flawlessly or immediately each time a button is pushed. Not a big deal, IMHO, especially because the Roku remote app, which I put on both my iPhone and my Kindle Fire HD last night, seems to work flawlessly. The app works so well that I think I'll put the regular remote in a drawer and just use the app. We opted for the stick because we have a wall mounted TV and don't have any room for a larger device.
customer_reviews.author: bantcher

customer_reviews.title: Save Yourself! Buy the ROKU 3600R
customer_reviews.text: We have a ROKU smart TV, which I love, this is way slower. I bought two of these, the first one I set up, watched TV for about 2-3 days. Then suddenly the remote wouldn't work, then the phone app remote wouldn't work. I tried everything Roku recommends, no dice. The second one would crash when setting up an update. Never did work. Because I love my Roku TV I returned these, and Amazon was awesome as always with the return, and I purchased a Roku Streaming Stick (3600R). Here is the deal...the 3600 is fast, its like a smart TV. Updated, setup and watching TV now with no issues. Buy the 3600R, thank me later.

It does work better with the phone app. Don't see why all the remotes of all roku products have to be so different.

customer_reviews.text: I have several Roku devices and love them all except THIS STICK. It has connectivity issues no matter which Smart TV I put it on. It has a terrible lag time, takes forever to load and freezes up on random channels. Right now it's on the STV that is 20 feet from my router. My Internet speed is 200/200. The wired Roku's I have are lightning fast, so I'll be ditching the Stick and I plan on getting the Ultra for my new 4k TV. BTW, Roku CS replaced Mt Stick for another and the same issues occurred. IDK what the problem is but I have no issues with any wireless device in my home except for this Stick.
customer_reviews.author: LeeDee

customer_reviews.title: Bottom line, it is a very slow device compared ...
customer_reviews.text: Bottom line, it is a very slow device compared to the Roku 3. Very slow navigating and loading channels, especially YouTube. Two to three times a week, device will freeze and reboot. Once video is selected to play, very slow loading and the buffering affects quality for first minute, then in random intervals. Tested a Roku 3 (also wireless) in same room and works perfectly. If $ is not an issue, Roku 3 or newer.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Works fine when powered externally
customer_reviews.text: Product works great. It does come with a power source. At first, I just connected the stick into the HDMI port. The stick will draw the power from the TV. First issue is that you have to wait for the Roku to boot up. On occasion, I would get error messages with most of the apps that the content was not viewable. I would do a soft rebook of the stick and everything worked. Something Roku needs to look into. I then decided to use the external power. Now, no waiting for the stick to reboot and no more error messages. Everything else works fine.
customer_reviews.author: JD1010

customer_reviews.title: BEST THING EVER!!
customer_reviews.text: I've lost count how many Roku's I've bought. I have my entire family hooked on it. lol My last Roku I bought, I took down to my parents' home in FL when visiting to show them what it's all about. Needless to say, I ended up leaving it there because they LOVED IT. They watch it every day, it's such a fantastic product!! The HD quality is terrific, as is the picture. I have totally cut the cord from cable, and I will never go back. THIS IS THE BEST THING SINCE SLICED BREAD. Do yourself a favor and buy one. (or in my case, like 4 or 5....lol)

customer_reviews.title: and thought this would be great for an older 42" LCD TV that I was ...

customer_reviews.title: Fussy but great when you work out the bugs
customer_reviews.text: I hated this stick initially and was about to return it- continuously dropping programs, losing high def picture, and losing internet connection. I spent an hour on the phone with comcast and they could not help as the wireless modem and wifi connection on other devices was working fine. Then I came across this article that describes how to change the code on your modem so roku will recognize it. Voila, end of problem.  It worked perfectly. All of the above problems resolved. Now I am afraid I will never leave the couch. The array of programming is incredible.
customer_reviews.author: reader

customer_reviews.title: Great for the smaller TV wall mount application
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my dad as he has a smaller conventional LCD TV on a wall mount with an electrical outlet behind the set. It has a great picture and no wires or cables are visible. Roku has added a bunch of free channels that have a lot of the older programming that he likes as well as all of the popular channels such as Hulu Plus and Netflix. Just a note that this works good up to 720P. If you have a large screen that supports a higher resolution you might want to go with a larger Roku however 720P looks pretty good on everything at and below a 32."
customer_reviews.author: Radon

customer_reviews.title: I'm very disappointed that my Roku stick did not function well while ...
customer_reviews.text: I'm very disappointed that my Roku stick did not function well while connected to the USB port in back of my flat screen TV. It took forever to boot up every time I turned on the television. I was forced to plug it into the power strip on the floor leading to an additional wire running from the television which was something I wanted to avoid. After that, it performed like it should. I also own a Roku 2 and I think it is a far better product than the stick if you don't mind an additional device on your console table.
customer_reviews.author: AlphaDog

customer_reviews.title: I love other Roku products, but the Stick was a failure for me
customer_reviews.text: I've owned multiple Roku devices over the years and I currently own two Roku 3, which I love. However, I found the Roku Stick to be a big failure. I had three problems with my Roku Stick: 1. The response was VERY slow. MUCH slower than the Roku 3 (or even the previous versions). 2. After about 9 months of use it would no longer play anything on ESPN, Netflix, or Amazon. 3. As of tonight it is completely dead and will not power on. Because of these issues, I cannot recommend the Roku Stick.
customer_reviews.author: T. Hunter

customer_reviews.title: Flaky remote
customer_reviews.text: I like the device and the software but I'm not impressed by the remote. The stick creates its own wifi network on the same channel as your home router and there is no way to change the channel. I can't confirm that it interferes with other wifi traffic, but bluetooth would have been a better option. I also had a lot of issues getting the remote to sync the first time. It's just not a clean implementation. Because of this, I haven't used it in a while. Maybe there is a firmware update that fixes the wifi issue?
customer_reviews.author: Scott Ames

customer_reviews.title: disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed in the 2 sticks I purchased. Neither one has made it to the 1 year mark. It seems like they over heated or something..because when I pulled them out of the TV after they stopped working - they were very warm almost hot. I have 3 roku's purchased before the fire stick - which are all working just fine. I almost feel bad writing a negative post about anything amazon related...because I have purchased every one of their kindles after they came out & gifted all but the 10.5 - those all are working fine..
customer_reviews.author: Liz

customer_reviews.title: Good streaming quality with a large selection of apps
customer_reviews.text: Good streaming quality with a large selection of apps. The value of the included free trials and rentals exceed the price of this streaming stick. The only cons are that it does lag a little in certain apps and the remote becomes non-responsive at times, it seems that the wifi remote that this model uses either goes into some sort of sleep mode or it has interference from other wifi devices as I have no problem with the remote on my Roku LT (which uses infrared). Using my smartphone as a remote for this device has been flawless.
customer_reviews.author: Mike S.

customer_reviews.title: Disappointment
customer_reviews.text: I've had this unit since September and the remote is already giving up the ghost--might be something as simple as lousy build on the battery contacts...who knows. Most of the time it fails to do what it 'posed to do--that simple. Prior to now, it has burned through too many AAA cells--be nice if there was a way to turn the unit off--again, who knows, since Roku has scant if not totally invisible documentation. Too bad--Roku is the only place to get Acorn or Mhz streams. Majorly disappointing. Quick PS: I've noted other critics have noted that the stick periodically "crashes" and needs a restart--how, pray tell, does one "restart" this unit.
customer_reviews.author: RCHEV

customer_reviews.title: A great option!
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a cost effective and streaming device and found this one on sale. I love Roku because it is truly provider agnostic meaning that it is not captive to any individual media provider like Amazon, Google or Apple. This device works exactly as expected. It was a great deal and does a fantastic job streaming video from a huge variety of sources. In short, I would highly recommend the Roku Streaming Stick and look forward to using it for years to come.
customer_reviews.author: Jay L

customer_reviews.title: The stick itself is pretty great and it takes away alot of the clutter ...
customer_reviews.text: The stick itself is pretty great and it takes away alot of the clutter around the TV. The problem we are experiencing on all 3 of the streaming sticks we purchased is that the remotes don't work well. We thought maybe it was the batteries that were sent with the product, so we bought brand new batteries and put them in, that doesn't seem to help. Every time you want to change the channel we have to hit the reset button in the remote or on the TV and move the batteries around to get it to work....and that is short lived. It is very frustrating.
customer_reviews.author: Ellen

customer_reviews.title: An Abject Failure By An Otherwise Rising Star In The Streaming Age
customer_reviews.text: While I have the earlier 3400X model of the stick, which works flawlessly, this 3500R model is just the opposite. It overheated, crashed, black screened, anything but worked. I sent it back to Amazon for a refund. I just purchased the 3600R model and will give that a try. I'm having trouble believing that Roku is balancing their lead in the streaming market on flawed products. Hopefully they will learn from Apple and Microsoft that pushing out substandard quality product will not bode well for them. If this 3600R is a failure, I will move over to Amazon streaming stick or Google and never look back. Roku - your reputation is what you are - learn that quickly!
customer_reviews.author: Monique Lutz

customer_reviews.title: I GAVE UP!  Very confusing and difficult to sync with phone -
customer_reviews.text: .This device came with NO instructions and symbols on the handset that are meaningless to me. It is totally non-intuitive. The interface with YouTube makes you search a title ... o .. n ... e .......l ... e ... t ... t ....e ... r .... a... t ..... a t ...i ...m .. e How can something like this come with NO instruction sheet?? Corporations' attempt to skimp every single cent is just over the top. The controller device is sitting on my bedside table gathering dust. I wish I had just gotten a Chromecast, but I'm past the return date for Amazon I think. I just got fed up with the time wasted.
customer_reviews.author: jj

customer_reviews.title: We already own a Roku 3 and it works great, but this little stick is worthless
customer_reviews.text: We already own a Roku 3 and it works great, but this little stick is worthless. It was not worth 2 hours of my time to discover it is obviously defective. It will not do the required software update (error code 011), so I tried the whole secret screen thing and tried that way. That resulted in error code 006, so some people recommended a factory reset and so I did that via the secret screen. Now it sticks on select language and will move no further. Calling India isn't worth my patience, so I'm returning it. I wouldn't recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Bring your Roku anywhere, I just love it.
customer_reviews.text: I have this in my laptop bag and it goes where my laptop goes. I love that I can insert into any tv with HDMI and I have all my channels. All I need to do with each new location is go to setup and enter the internet connection info for that location. If you lose the remote or run out of batteries, no big deal. Roku has a droid app that lets your phone operate as the remote and it works great. I so much love this little device and it does everything the more expensive bigger unit does. Not even sure why you have to bother getting the more expensive unit since this does the same trick.
customer_reviews.author: Jody Windland

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Love my new toy. Still learning my way around it and checking out some of the different channels, but I really like that I don't have to hook my laptop up to the TV whenever I want to watch Netflix, TWC app, and Amazon Video anymore. It was between this and the Fire TV stick when I purchased it (both were on sale Black Friday), and I really was leaning toward the Fire stick because I love the Amazon products. But after reading reviews and finding out that the TWC app wasn't compatible with the Fire stick, Roku was the clear choice.
customer_reviews.author: kenoqueen

customer_reviews.title: So Happy!
customer_reviews.text: I love my new Roku! It still has to be plugged in because our TV I guess doesn't have enough juice to power it solo. The coard to plug it in isn't very long so we had to plug in a power strip and set it on the entertainment stand to be able to plug both the stick into the tv and into a power source. But that's different for everyone. As for performance it's fantastic! I love the set up so much more than the original Roku and it's definitely a bit faster. The remote is smaller and more lightweight and I think a little less sensitive than the original.
customer_reviews.author: Karen Sherman

customer_reviews.title: ok. But frustrating config and sometimes unreliable.
customer_reviews.text: Somewhat slow compared to the Roku 3. I've had some issues with it randomly refusing to connect to the WiFi. Seems unreliable compared with Chromecast in this respect. It does have the advantage of working with Amazon streaming which is lacking in Chromecast. It's also difficult to enter secure WiFi passwords. i.e. long 64 character random ASCII entry with the remote is slow and frustrating. Unlike Chromecast where you just cut and paste it into the configuration app on your phone or tablet. Picture quality is fine. But if you can live without amazon streaming I would just get the cheaper Chromecast. However it does support TimeWarner Live TV streaming from your home network and Chromecast doesn't.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy!!
customer_reviews.text: We got a tcl roku tv in one room and loved it, so we decided to get one of these sticks for the other room man do I regret it. So we bought one stick it was working fine for like a week then it start freezing up. I returned it and replaced it with another one. Never did i think i would have the same issue with the 2nd but this time around since i didn't think it could happened 2 didn't try it out untill about 2 weeks from receiving it. This stick is a piece of #%#÷.don't waste your time and money! The 2nd stick did the same thing 2 day after my return time is up!!
customer_reviews.author: Ekglove

customer_reviews.title: Terrific little device it's easy to set up and works very well
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my sons apartment and it works terrific. Very simple to set up and has just about every app you can think about. He doesn't even have cable TV sets my cable provider allows for me to set up a separate account for him which he can use with HBO, Showtime, ESPN Apps that come with this. Produces a very high-quality picture even at 15 Mb per second, which is his cable speed. I love hot just plugs right into the HDMI on his TV though you either have to power with the included USB cable or use The included power adapter. But most people to come over don't even know that it's there
customer_reviews.author: Steve-o

customer_reviews.title: Small and yet so powerful
customer_reviews.text: What a pleasant surprise and great experience this has been. This was very easy setup and and using with my prime membership. If you have Netflix also very nice. You can add other channels in the search for many free channels and programs. I dropped Satellite TV and now just use my 3 meg hi speed through my phone line provider and it works great. Save hundreds of $$ a years and able to better utilize my Prime membership. lots of free stuff some not free just make sure it says prime. Lot's of apps pre-loaded but be careful many want you to put a credit card on file. I will never do that, but you may not care?
customer_reviews.author: indyj

customer_reviews.title: great product, low price
customer_reviews.text: Extremely cool little device. Memory stick size. Very low price. Super easy to plug in, set up and operate, even for us non-techies. You'll probably want the 90 degree angle adapter, so the Roku power cord isn't crushed against the wall behind your flatscreen. The Roku accesses a book length list of channels, even here in Costa Rica where US channels are sometimes restricted. The device doesn't enable direct wifi access to the internet, so you can't sit back and use your TV as a remote controlled big screen iPad to watch internet content. But for watching the innumerable channels it accesses, the Roku is a great little device.
customer_reviews.author: derryl

customer_reviews.title: Great concept - shoddy construction
customer_reviews.text: If this stick was constructed properly it would be great. Unfortunately the HDMI plug was loose right out of the box and never made a good connection in the port on the TV. Had to use electrical tape to apply sideways pressure on the stick in the TV just to get the power light to work. Lasted a few months this way until HDMI plug completely broke and could no longer establish any connection with the TV. Very disappointed in the quality of construction.
customer_reviews.author: amazonguy

customer_reviews.title: Simple.  Has what I need, but requires credit card during setup
customer_reviews.text: Pro: I have Google's Nexus Player, which I love for the ChromeCast, but it doesn't have Amazon Prime. And, Amazon's Fire Stick lacks Google Play Movie & TV, where I purchase videos. The Roku has both Amazon Prime and Google Play Movie & TV. I would give the device 5 stars if it would allow for ChromeCasting, but it does not. Con: It requires a Roku account, which requires a credit card. I don't plan on purchasing anything with Roku and I'm not comfortable having my credit card another site's server. But, I made the sacrifice so I could get access to the Amazon Prime account that I pay for yearly.
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: Great product, terrible remote
customer_reviews.text: I love the Roku stick and all the applications it has available but the remote is terrible. I use this device every couple days and it works great and I don't have any connection issues. My two issues with this product are the 1) remote and 2) does not all for network configuration. If you don't mind having to use your phone as the remote and don't need to make any network configurations beyond Wi-Fi password for the price I would recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah T.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: Some try to compare roku stick to chromecast but honestly there's no comparison here. Roku is way ahead of chromecast. I was one of the first to preorder chromecast great idea but never went ahead from the starting point. With Roku possibilities are endless. Time Warner app Amazon Netflix vudu hulu you name it they have it. And have a remote control included in this price no one can beat that. I have Roku 3, TCL roku tv and the stick. Three time Warner receiver with no monthly fee. I would return the DVR the moment Roku comes up with recording solution. Don't hesitate. Great buy.
customer_reviews.author: CaptainJimmmy

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I chose the Roku over other streaming devices for many reasons. One reason is that it's so small and convenient. Not only can you turn your own TV into a Smart TV in seconds, you can take it with you to hotels, friends, etc. without lugging around a box. Another reason is that the remote was included, so were the batteries. All in one little package, setup took seconds and BOOM, my TV was instantly smart! NO MORE HIGH PRICED CABLE OR SATELLITE PACKAGES! Never again! Plenty of channels to choose from, many of them are 100% free. Love the Roku Streaming Stick!
customer_reviews.author: C. Myers

customer_reviews.title: I just love my Roku
customer_reviews.text: I just love my Roku! For a person who is on a fix income who can't afford both cable and internet access, I choose to drop my cable, and replace it with a Roku box that connects the internet to my TV, and I'm glad I did. Sure not all the channels are as prime that you would normally get thru a cable or satellite receiver, but at least most of the digital networks that you do get thru the internet based Roku receiver are free, where it at least gives you more options than just your every day local over the air TV stations where I just can't justify the cost of cable or satellite anymore.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey Hirsch

customer_reviews.title: Buy the roku box instead
customer_reviews.text: We bought two Roku sticks and have owned a Roku box for years.The Roku box is much better. The loading on The sticks is noticeably slower. We plugged one of them into the wall instead of the tv and that improved the function a bit. But overall not recommended. We bought because the idea of a hidden Roku is nice. But this item needs work. We have this one purchased here and the newer version Roku stick purchased at Wal-Mart. Neither are as good as the Roku box.
customer_reviews.author: Jal11

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful Tech Gadget!!!
customer_reviews.text: Works great. I have one in my room. I got one for my hubby for Christmas and just got it installed and running for him. He was really excited. These little gadgets are one of the best new tech. things I've gotten lately. I find them easy to set up. I just wish Roku had a way for linked sticks to read the stored information on others so you didn't have to update each set as you acquire additional subscriptions. Getting close to eliminating Comcast and just using Roku...as soon as we figure out all the channels we need to subscribe to.
customer_reviews.author: PudditatTop Contributor: Nail Art

customer_reviews.title: Quality Control, what's that?
customer_reviews.text: Constantly has to be resynced with the remote. You'll be scrolling through selections and suddenly you can't scroll any more. Then you have to open the remote, remove a battery, reinsert it and then wait for it to sync again before you can continue. This is our second Roku unit (the other is a Roku 3) and both have had annoying problems (the other keeps losing the wifi connection, even though it's,literally, just two feet away from the router, and no other devices in the house have any issues connecting) which makes me think Roku has some pretty big quality control issues. We won't be buying a third unit from them.
customer_reviews.author: B.W. Behling

customer_reviews.title: Can't be beat
customer_reviews.text: This little stick is a game changer! Cut the cord and cancel your cable! Robust are great because they work with all the various streaming services. In comparison, my Samsung Smart TV works consistently with Netflix, but sometimes has trouble with Hulu, and it only rarely works with the HBO Go app. Because Roku is so popular, the streaming services put more time into maintaining and developing their apps for it.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan

customer_reviews.title: Say goodbye to Cable TV. Hello ROKU!
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE THIS DEVICE. I was able to kiss my cable company goodbye and I can watch anything and everything I want.. I no longer have to be aggravated with the Cable company for they crummy service. The ROKU is instant streaming using the same wireless router hook-up I used for computer Internet access. There are hundreds of free channels.. but I already have NetFlix, Hulu and Amazon Prime accounts. If I was retired and had 24/7 to watch television, I would not run out of programming for the next 10 lifetimes. And I don't have to pay the cable company. Do you know how happy that makes me? Excellent purchase; fantastic price; lightning fast delivery with Amazon Prime.
customer_reviews.author: Theresa Moore

customer_reviews.title: Great device if placed on the side of TV
customer_reviews.text: I have owned several Roku devices since they were first introduced to the market. My original Roku burned out after several years of use. Now I have a small HD box and this streaming stick. I definitely prefer the box over the stick simply because the streaming stick only works if it is placed in one of the ports on the side of the TV and I have to try aiming the remote a few times before I can get it to register. Other than that, I'm happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Travelsinheels

customer_reviews.title: Better than a smart TV and cable box combined!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I love my Roku streaming sticks! I wanted to get a cable box for the television in my bedroom but someone suggested I try a Roku stick. That was a year ago and since then I have purchased four more. I tell everyone about this product. I really hate watching commercials so I have subscriptions to Hulu and Netflix. One of the best things is that you can add your television provider's channel which gives you access to most of the features you get with a box but there is no additional monthly fee. I highly recommend!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: E Baker

customer_reviews.title: Slow for Netflix
customer_reviews.text: O bought Roku Streaming Sick to watch Netflix in a non smart TV. After Roku updated it`s software and restarted, I found it too slow to load the movies. My first suspect was the wireless signal, although it worked fine with my mobile phone. I bought a wireless access point and installed in the same room, to make sure the signal was good. Netflix movies and menus are still slow to load. Next time I will buy an Apple TV.
customer_reviews.author: Milliet

customer_reviews.title: Freezing and buffering
customer_reviews.text: This stick is good in concept but had many problems that made it unusable. While watching any channel it would buffer constantly. The menus would freeze to the point that you had to turn on and off to get it to work. I replaced with a Roku 2 and those problems have gone away, particularly the menu freezing or remote not working. Internet speed will impact the playback but the change in model made playback work almost 100% of the time with without internet speed change. The interface is the same which is great and easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: gbf77

customer_reviews.title: Potential to Overheat
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this in April 2016 and used it as my "travel" version - so it only was used about 4 weeks out of a year and is usually kept in a box. I used it a few days ago, but it no longer works. It appears to me that the plastic melted over the pins in the HDMI connection. So although I liked using this and will probably purchase a newer model, it does concern me that it has the opportunity to get hot enough to melt. Please see the picture below.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I personally would recommend this over the built in versions of apps on ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a solid product for getting all the "smart features" onto your big screen. I personally would recommend this over the built in versions of apps on many TV models simply because of its speed in navigating the menus. It is smooth and picks up WiFi singles very well for its size. Using these external devices is also much easier to upgrade over time as you do not have to replace the TV to upgrade the "smart" features.
customer_reviews.author: D. Oberholtzer

customer_reviews.title: Decent streaming if you have wifi fast enough.
customer_reviews.text: Use this almost every night. Runs faster if you plug into electrical outlet than usb to tv (since most tv's have a usb outlet now.) Wish the remote had different default buttons since I'll never use vudu or blockbuster instant video (those are defaults on mine besides netflix and amazon video) the product image shows radio and google play which might be a newer version remote. We have ~60mbps wifi and it streams pretty well although quality and speed decrease at peak hours. also doesn't have great wifi reception (our router is across the house.) I get 5 bar reception with my laptop and only 3-4 on the roku from the same room.
customer_reviews.author: AxisAmazing

customer_reviews.title: Works great with slow internet
customer_reviews.text: I'm actually a little shocked at how well this works, considering that my internet is pretty slow. Love that I finally have access to HBOGo, Netflix, Amazon Prime, and YouTube on my TV instead of my computer-- and at a much higher quality than I'm used to. For example, on my computer if I wanted to watch a video on YouTube, the highest quality that I'd be able to use without waiting 20 minutes for it to load would be 480p. On the Roku Streaming Stick the video will automatically play on HD with no hesitation or pauses to buffer. I'm feeling very spoiled!
customer_reviews.author: a

customer_reviews.title: User friendly & now gives freedom from expensive "smart" tv's & blu-ray player options.
customer_reviews.text: The set up took a bit longer than I expected due to several steps, but could have been shortened by not spending time reviewing the options of which apps to include during set up. With that said, I do like that I had a choice of which apps to include instead of being stuck with dozens I'll never use having to scroll through those to get to the ones I do use. Overall, if you take a little extra time upfront to do all the options, this is a user friendly design, very simple to use & I'm now considering purchasing more to replace my expensive blu-ray players that seem to break after 6-12 months of use.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy Chemacki

customer_reviews.title: Works ok...very slow compared to a roku 3.
customer_reviews.text: It works ok. I am used to a roku 3 and compared to that this is very slow. If you are new to roku or have not used a roku 3-4 then you will probably be fine with this. But if you are used to the speed of a roku 3 you will probably be disappointed in how long it takes to navigate menus on this and for information to populate from the apps
customer_reviews.author: Bob Bobson

customer_reviews.title: God awful
customer_reviews.text: This is seriously a piece of crap. I realize it's a stick and not the Roku box so it won't have the same processing power, but it is incredibly slow and sometimes non-responsive. Once it starts up, which again takes a long time, I have to hit buttons over and over again in order for it do anything. Also, it disconnects from the internet quite often. Currently, it's doing nothing - as in it's frozen. Don't buy this product. Spend the extra money and get the Roku 2/3 or the newer Roku stick, which seems to have better reviews. I should have stuck with Chromecast.
customer_reviews.author: Tina

customer_reviews.title: Love hate
customer_reviews.text: Loved this device until I lost the remote. But wait there's an app you can use ? ! Ok I love it again. Got a new modem and I'm back to hating this stupid thing. YOU MUST HAVE THE PHYSICAL REMOTE to connect to wifi. Bottom line is roku site offers the remote for $19.99 but just my luck... it stays out of stock. Amazon sells one for over $31 n some change which is crazy considering the device brand new is $46.99. I'm forced to buy a new device now which is ridiculous. I will no longer be a roku customer.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa C

customer_reviews.title: A good buy except for MLB.tv app performance
customer_reviews.text: This works great. I upgraded from a Roku 1. This one is faster and has more channel options. However, it worked so much better for me when I plugged it into an outlet versus taking power from the TV. If it's powered from the TV, the Roku will have to boot up and that takes a while. Update - The MLB.tv app on Roku is really poor. The performance is so bad that it displays "loading, please wait" almost as often as showing a game. If I stream from the MLB.tv web site to my computer, no problems. Do no buy this if you MLB.tv is an important app to you.
customer_reviews.author: Mack

customer_reviews.title: What's not to like about Roku
customer_reviews.text: What's not to like about Roku? TV today is mostly garbage and studies show that passive watching of TV contributes to brain degeneration (did we really need a study?), but when we are actively seeking the content that we want to watch, it does not have the negative effects. I got this for my mother, who is newly retired. I don't think she has bought into it yet, but she does have a Netflix and Amazon Prime membership, so hopefully she will see how great it is. You would think that the HMDI stick being behind the tV, that there would be remote control communication issues, but it works fine.
customer_reviews.author: EzereBartonne

customer_reviews.title: so it feels like you have cable TV
customer_reviews.text: A bit slow compared with the chromecast and at the time I bought this it was compatible with less apps. But you don't need a smartphone to control this, so it feels like you have cable TV. Also, be aware that if you are not in USA, you can't access to the same content because of the GEO restrictions.
customer_reviews.author: Leonardo

customer_reviews.title: Didn't think I needed this, but I do.
customer_reviews.text: Have a PS3 and a Chromecast, but wanted to see if this could fit into my life somehow. The PS3 is a little clunky with the controller and navigation. The Chromecast is a little too minimalist with no interface or controller. The Roku is the perfect marriage of everything. Interface is fantastic, really streamlines everything together. The remote is the killer feature here that makes it all worth it. All the apps are fun to explore and play around with. The Chromecast has gone on the bedroom TV. The Roku earns the spot for the main TV. We love it. Picture quality is great. To echo others, yes, it's a little slow, but not terribly so.
customer_reviews.author: Anchovies

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful wonderful! The color is so much more amazing ...
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful wonderful! The color is so much more amazing than anything I have ever used. All of my apps run very smoothly. And the selection of apps is more than the other products out there. Update 11/2015. This is probably one of the best purchases I have ever made. I have been given access to such a wide variety of information I will forever be grateful to Roku for freeing me from my cable subscription. Before Roku I was actually physically ill from all of the garbage cancer causing foods being constantly shoved into my face just because I wanted to watch a game. Well, now there are ways around that and I will never trust mainstream media again.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointing
customer_reviews.text: I was very excited to buy this product. However, after 2 months, I would return it if Amazon would let me. (They won't.) Here are my disappointments with this product: (1) It is NOT cordless like the pictures display. There is a very long cord that plugs into the stick that still falls along the wall and plugs into an outlet. (2) The remote is VERY SLOW in loading new channels or programs. (3) ***MOST IMPORTANT**** The stick itself OVERHEATS when left plugged in and simply wont work at all. I have to remember to actually unplug it from the wall when I am done watching TV - and not just turn off the TV. THATS ABSURD!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Lauren

customer_reviews.title: Saves me lots of money!!!
customer_reviews.text: The Roku streaming stick was the first step for me to be able to cut the cord with cable TV. In addition to making my "dumb" TV into a smart TV I found that Roku itself has many great channels and lots to watch. I also bought one for my smart TV and now I am free of Cable debt. I only pay for what I want to pay for and that totals $16.00 a month. A far cry from the $167.00 I have been paying. And I get more variety than with cable. I am very happy. Of course you need Wi-fi internet to stream from the computer to the TV but I would have Wi-fi regardless.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: it could be better
customer_reviews.text: I own a ROKU 2, so comparing it to that... I like: auto play in between episodes, no need to select the next episode to play. Very nice picture quality, nicer on-screen layout than Roku 2 I dont like: slow response to the remote control, everything you do lags one second at least. it does a full re-start everytime you turn on the TV (if you have plugged it to the USB port in your TV as opposed to a power outlet) Overall "I like it" so 3 stars, if they can solve my "i dont likes" then 5 stars
customer_reviews.author: AmazonReviewer0068

customer_reviews.title: I'll make this short and sweet. I received the stick today from Amazon with ...
customer_reviews.text: I'll make this short and sweet. I received the stick today from Amazon with Prime two-day shipping and installed it with absolutely no problems whatsoever. I followed all the prompts and each step went according to plan. It took about 15 minutes total including the updates which consumed about half the total time. The wifi connection operates a little slower than the box did but it is worth it to be rid of the extra cable and the box. The stick is connected very discreetly behind the TV and out of sight. Great for a wall-mounted TV. BTW this is my second stick and both are operating flawlessly.
customer_reviews.author: ROYMAC

customer_reviews.title: Extreme patience required
customer_reviews.text: It is shockingly slow and sluggish, took ages to connect to my Wifi and every time I turn on the TV it's at least a few minutes before I can do anything. The remote works at most 10% of the time, otherwise it just doesn't do anything and I have to wait for it to decide it wants to work, and when it finally starts working, it last about 10 seconds before cutting out, so I have to take advantage of that short time window. I have tried different batteries and I'm definitely in range, I even stood 1 foot away from the Roku and spent a few minutes trying to get it to respond.
customer_reviews.author: Lee

customer_reviews.title: No More Cable Bills
customer_reviews.text: We have completely cut cable and use only this as our source of television entertainment (subscribed to Amazon Prime, Netflix, Hulu, and CBS All Access which totals @about $30.00 a month). The only issue is the remote. I've found the only way to keep it working is to pull the batteries out when you're not using it... as in even while you are watching TV but not actively using the remote. Otherwise it just chews through batteries. You can use an app on your smart phone as a remote, but sometimes it has trouble loading which can be a little frustrating when you need to pause or change your program. Other than that. I am very satisfied with this device.
customer_reviews.author: Aundrea

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Disappointing when compared to Roku3. The Roku stick is unacceptably slow. Once it becomes unresponsive, the only option is to shut it down and watch the Roku logo jump on the screen while is powers up. It is very slow from power on be able to watch anything. When it freezes, the iOS app also becomes useless just like its remote. The remote, itself doesn't work all the time, it's erratic. I got this because Chromecast just stopped connecting to my network. The difference in speed in these two devices unbelievable. Will be returning this.
customer_reviews.author: Salil Bhatnagar

customer_reviews.title: Minor Bugs
customer_reviews.text: I came across two bugs during installation: 1. I have a brand new Samsung PN51F5300 in our bedroom, and the Roku stick doesn't seem to work with HDMI Input #2 (DVI). HDMI Input #1 seems to work fine, so I swapped my cable box to HDMI #2. 2. During the update process, the Roku stick would not generate an access code. I had to reset the unit to factory defaults THREE times before it worked properly. I'm hoping that it'll be smooth sailing from here on out, but the installation process was very frustrating for me, and I would consider myself "tech savvy." I can assemble a desktop PC and install Windows, but the "plug-n-play" Roku stick had me fuming.
customer_reviews.author: That Guy

customer_reviews.title: CAREFUL!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased two of these for older members of my family. I spent about a half a day with tech support and finally got it connected to wifi. NOW it tells me on the set up screen that I must provide an email address and a credit card in order to use this device!!!!! Which they do not have!!! I have used Roku devices in the past without all this b.s. I got on tec support again to see if that was for real... It's for real. And totally absurd. Just another facility having your credit card on file jeopardizing your security. I sent them back.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer Jim

customer_reviews.title: Roku gives you a experience more like using a cable box whereas Chromecast is easier to ...
customer_reviews.text: I have cut the cable cord in my house and use both Rokus and Chromecasts. Roku gives you a experience more like using a cable box whereas Chromecast is easier to cast video from the Chrome browser. Both of them need companion software like Playon, Plex and others and there is a learning curve because none of them are as intuitive or have instructions that are as user friendly as one would expect. Even the Roku setup requires a learning curve and casting to it using Playon or Plex are glitchy (Fox News, CNBC and other that use their own player especially).
customer_reviews.author: Vincent Cobelo

customer_reviews.title: Good streaming device, with the added ability to display Android and Windows devices
customer_reviews.text: We had a Roku 2 XD and wanted to replace it for two reasons. First, we wanted to use Miracast to wirelessly display our Windows tablets and Android smartphones on the TV. Second, we wanted to eliminate the power and HDMI cables. The new streaming stick took care of both of those issues. Navigating through the menus, the streaming stick seems to be a bit more sluggish than the XD, but streaming performance is fine, and it's great that the device has no cables cluttering up the area behind the TV. (We're using a short USB cable to power the stick directly from the TV.)
customer_reviews.author: Brian W

customer_reviews.title: Roku Stick Enhances TV/Movie Viewing!
customer_reviews.text: I own 2 of the stick Roku streaming devices in my home and they are very convenient. I also just purchased one for a wedding gift and like it because I have greater channel capabilities than my current cable TV set-up and can watch free movies, get weather updates, live news broadcasts and so many other free channels, etc. This is a very handy, very versatile product that allows for live TV broadcasts that stream in from your computer's WiFi network. I love my Roku devices!
customer_reviews.author: Mike in Linden, Mi

customer_reviews.title: Very Upset no ROKU,,
customer_reviews.text: I am very concerned .I bout this less then a year ago and the remote does not work as of yesterday. This is the first time I have had a problem with something I bought from Amazon....I will not be buying anymore electronics.I now have to buy another...Disappointed...Caroline Hayes Just checked only had for 5 months...I have a Email for all my positive yet no answer about this one negative..Even if you can do nothing an answer would be nice....
customer_reviews.author: caroline hayes

customer_reviews.title: Sorry I bought it
customer_reviews.text: After 5 months this thing started with the purple screen, HDMI error. Roku says it is your tv, the cable used etc. Bottom line is that everything else works in the port that the Roku stopped functioning in. Apple, Amazon stick, other Roku boxes. I moved this to a different tv and it worked there for another maybe 5 months then got really flakey. It runs wicked hot. Junk
customer_reviews.author: Josie

customer_reviews.title: I love my Roku
customer_reviews.text: I love my Roku. Not only can you stream content from major companies (netflix, youtube,hulu, etc), there are tons of Roku apps and games you can play. All on your TV. The only problem I have ever had with my Roku is the remote. For whatever reason, sometimes the box just won't recognize it. Restarting it usually fixes the issue, and I have the Roku App on my phone just in case it goes wonky, but that's the biggest issue I've had with it that I've not been able to find a solution for. That aside, I have nothing but good things to say about Roku.
customer_reviews.author: Elly Wynn

customer_reviews.title: great for country living
customer_reviews.text: My wife and I love it. We live out in the country where the only options for Internet are the phone company and satellite. Satellite internet sucks but our phone company internet is quite fast. We both have iPads and I have played Xbox online with no skipping or pauses. That said, we are not big television watchers so paying for cable or satellite TV makes no sense for us. This thing allows us to have a Netflix account and my Amazon Prime for movies and tv shows when we get a chance to sit down and it is fast and streams well. We love it.
customer_reviews.author: Ramsey

customer_reviews.title: Too slow/laggy to NOT be annoyed
customer_reviews.text: Just doesn't compare to the Roku box. Its much slower than I expected, so much so, I got annoyed and returned it for the Roku 3 (which I love). Im an avid Apple fan and still prefer the Roku over the Apple TV. Each box has its place and demographic. The Roku offers way more channels than the Apple TV, including Amazon VOD, which the Apple TV doesn't have. The response of the UI is slow and laggy. The remote doesn't always respond since the stick is behind the TV. I will have to move around with the remote to get it to work, very annoying.
customer_reviews.author: OE

customer_reviews.title: You can adjust font size, color, background and opacity for subtitles and captions with the roku streaming stick.
customer_reviews.text: If you want to adjust fonts on subtitles this is the best! Even though I have a brand new Samsung Smart TV, I have my roku plugged in to get the apps which Samsung doesn't support. Even for the apps which are supported by the Smart tv, I watch using the roku streaming stick because I can make the subtitles huge with transparent background. No problem reading everything from 15 feet away!. It was very easy to install and connect to my accounts on various internet sites.
customer_reviews.author: Kdgrandma

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: Awesome. I have been a roku user for 10 plus years and have always been a fan. My most recent TV purchase was a 65 inch Samsung smart TV but I found that I did not at all like the Samsung interface after being used to a roku. Samsung was also limited in application options. Clicked this baby in with a powered USB attachment (purchased separately) and now never use the Samsung smart TV option. I just click over my source to this on HDMI and use the roku remote to control the TV. Love this purchase. Going to order one for my mom who has a smart Panasonic TV with an even worse user interface.
customer_reviews.author: Karen Colomb - Do Not Open

customer_reviews.title: Use almost daily for the kids and to bingewatch series at night
customer_reviews.text: Purchased in April 2014 to stream mostly netflix on an older plasma TV. Use almost daily for the kids and to binge watch series at night. Within the past 6 months noticing that the unit freezes randomly and I'll have to disconnect the power and restart which can take ~5 min. Not a huge inconvenience yet, but if it becomes more frequent i may have to update this review.
customer_reviews.author: TAG

customer_reviews.title: I love it, but it does have some tradeoffs...
customer_reviews.text: Use it everyday. Pros: A plethora of programming! Netflix, BYUTv, Amazon, Blockbuster, Plex, PBS, and hundreds more. Good speeds with a strong wireless signal. Love the Roku app on our android devices. Always good when the kids 'hide' the remote. Cons: Slow sometimes, especially when booting and first launching Netflix. The remote doesn't always work for me, though I've noticed that it works much better since relocating my router to the same room as the Roku stick (not sure why). My opinion is that the Roku 3 may be a better investment since it has wireless and wired options.
customer_reviews.author: bennyboy

customer_reviews.title: Reliable product. Very slow processor.
customer_reviews.text: I already own a Roku 3. The Roku 3 is an amazing device that works amazing. I wanted a Roku streaming stick to take with me when I travel for work so that I could watch my shows on the hotel TV. After using this device a handful of times I realized that it is extremely slow. There is quite a bit of lag in its operation versus the Roku 3. It works fine and I was able to use all of the functions that I wanted. Just be aware that if you're used to a faster processing Roku device, the streaming stick is going to feel extremely slow. That was very disappointing to me.
customer_reviews.author: FlexBuffChest

customer_reviews.title: Much better than having a box to fiddle with!  And more flexible with TV's
customer_reviews.text: Works great! Now I don't use cable and saved $170 a month. I bought a new car(2013) with payments of $170 a month! My favorite car, a Fiat 500! See what happens when you lose cable and get Roku? Also, I have to take my tinier TV to live temporarily at my rented home out of state to get a new renter this summer. I get to see TV without cable there. I use a wireless device on my laptop for a few weeks. Made in the Shade! And I don't have to deal with the ugly cable companies. Also, HBO GO will be selling their shows directly to customers in April! Great for customers. Bad for cable!
customer_reviews.author: Lee (Female)

customer_reviews.title: It's great!  Possible solution for setup problems detailed.
customer_reviews.text: I'm enjoying it immensely. There was a problem, however, setting it up. I went through setup twice and it froze before loading the channels. I then reset the streaming stick to factory condition and after that nothing worked. Solution that worked for me: There is a tiny purple button in the battery compartment. I pushed and held the purple button until the Roko logo showed up on my TV screen, then I replaced the battery cover and went through setup again and this time everything proceeded and worked flawlessly. I suspect this solution might work for remotes that quit working about which some posters have commented.
customer_reviews.author: Shirl

customer_reviews.title: Great Device.  Roku is the only way to go.
customer_reviews.text: Roku ROCKS. What more is there to say. WAY WAY more channel options than Chromesticks, easy to connect and up and running in just minutes. This is my 2nd Roku device, use them both on 2 different non-internet TV's. And ROKU is the only one so far w/ Amazon Prime streaming video. Chromestick? Nope. The WiFi receiver on this seems really good, I've never had a dropped signal even tho its clear across the house from my router. Zero complaints. Small size, fits out of sight behind the TV and powers from the TV USB port, so no extra cords needed. It can be plugged into a wall outlet if your TV doesn't have a powered USB port.
customer_reviews.author: jimb

customer_reviews.title: Worked fine for 7 months and now will not power up
customer_reviews.text: I decided to try the Stick for my third TV instead of a traditional Roku which I have on my other two TVs. I purchased it new 7 months ago. My TV no longer recognizes it and the light won't turn on when either plugged in or powered through USB. I have tried doing a hard reset, unplugging, trying a new outlet, trying exclusive USB, and the power indicator light will not turn on. This is a dismal addition to my Roku collection and I think I will try the Amazon Fire Stick instead.
customer_reviews.author: Champ Camp

customer_reviews.title: Not Up To Par. Look to the Roku 3 or Fire TV stick.
customer_reviews.text: Product was ok at first. It supports most of the same applications as the standard Roku box. It was though signicantly slower and lagged terribly. Even the remote was slow to respond. The roku remote app also constantly had issues connecting to the device. Now, after four months of use, the device has stopped functioning and is stuck on the loading screen. I will be buying a Fire TV stick to replace this device. At least the Fire TV device has an android based operating system which may allow for customization. Now, if the Fire TV devices would just support HBO go.
customer_reviews.author: GreeneNativeFish

customer_reviews.title: I like it!!
customer_reviews.text: Well, its much cheaper than my local satellite providers monthly bill. You're not going to be able to get your favorite channels live of course and some of the programs have ads. However, those that do have ads are approx. a minute, more or less. Big deal. Its still better than 5, 6, or 7 minute ads four times within 30 minutes. Most of the present TV programs are just mind dumbing so I don't miss them at all. There is plenty of good content available with Roku. Sports, travel, cooking, movies. If you want to spend .99 cents you can bypass the ads or for a couple of bucks a month you can access your favorite shows.
